head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #19

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #19 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Nancy Hired Transport on her passage to Moy from Michilimakinac in the month of October 1813[.]

At 6 AM hove up & run for St Josephs at ½ past 7 came too at St Josephs with the best bower shook the reefs out of the Topsails & dryed sails – wind at South & cloudy weather at noon clears away, threw some of the stones overboard find the vessel too much by the head, at 4 PM wind ESE & moderate breezes – a canoe arrived this day from Montreal loaded with goods from Makina[c,] at 8 PM Set the watch – last part of the night showery from the NE: with light airs, very unsettled weather[.]

First part of this 24 hours light breezes at NNE & cloudy weather, at 8 AM hoisted the boat in & got under weigh, at 10 clear of the Detour calm & pleasant weather, at 11 wind NNW & light all sail set course SE by S½S at 2 PM wind W, at 4 WNW at 6 NW & freshens the south shore distant about 6 miles at 8 took in the fore sail jibbs & fore top gallant sail, at 9 took in the main sail, blows fresh, Thunder bay Islands distant about 4 miles hauled off SE, ½ past 9 abreast of them bearing SW at 10 course SSE, wind the same, flying clouds from the NW latter part strong breezes at West[.]

First part of this 24 hours blows fresh from the Westward at 4 AM wind & weather the same at 8 set single reefed main sail at 9 set the fore sail course since 8 S by E passed the Point of Ba[rk] about 6 AM, at 10 shook the reef out of the main sail course S½ East, cloudy cool weather – at 2 gain sight of the rivers mouth at 3 PM came too in 4 fathom water about a mile from the Rivers mouth hoisted the boat out & sent 4 hands with a Mr Reaume & Tromp on shore to enquire of the Inhabitan[ts] what state the country was in about Detroit, on the Boats attempting to come off she was struck by a sea which[h] filled the boat – lost the boats rudder[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
